doc.str: Forest fires are generally considered a destructiveand undesirable event in forest managment, because fires can lead to severe environmental damages by releasing large amount of carbon. Therefore, estimation of fire emmissions has been intensively studied by fire science community. There are several methods to estimate fire emmissions released by different researchers. Generally, fire emmissions can be estimated ushing fire and fuel properties, including area burned, fuel loading or consumption factor, emmission factor, and fuel moisture. This methodlogy is based on traditional fire science in fuel inventory and experimental design. It cases some diffiuclties when the outdated data used and lack of fuel survey data. In recent years, remote sensing is one of the new methodology for estimating carbon released by forest fire. Remote sensing has showed its powerful capacity in estimating carbon release. However, this method costs high budget on obtaining the source and high techniques on processing the data. The present seeks to collect the current methods on estimating carbon released by fires and selects a suitable one for Taiwan. The results are expect to provide useful information for objective of this project (1) to establish a method fore estimatation carbon released by forest fire to be used in Taiwan, (2) to integrate fire database for the input of calculation of carbon release, and (3) to suggest emission reductions techniques.
Carbon and Fuel Management in Taiwan Red Pine Forest
The Strategy of Forest Management to Resonse Kyoto Protocol

arr.name: attribute
arr.str: tree number each tree surveyed within the sampling plot the number is a id of the survey tree without any unit dimensionless
Species species with its Chinese name The name of surveyed tree used Chinese common name and will be mapped to real scientific name if it is necessary
Treestat each tree status surveyed using three classes to describe tree status surveyed by live,dead standing, and broken standing
TreeHT Tree Height of each tree tree hight measured by tree height portable scale. Estimated the height by using traditional forest survey method meter
DBH each tree Diameter tree diameter using soft meter scale to measure. by measuring upslope and downslope two dimensions and averaged the values to indicate the diameter centimeter
Biomassw the weight of the survey tree the weight is the subsamples taken from the tree after cutting down and weight fhe fresh weight in the field then ovendried with 103c in the lab gram
brushid the brush surveyed within the sampling plot the id used a number for survey recording dimensionless
bspecies species name of each surveyed brush with Chinese name If necessary, the brushes were identifed and gave a scientific name
BrushHT each brush height measured by using a 10 meter pole using in the fiels meter
BasalD diameter of the brush from the basal area this basal diameter was measured by using soft meter scale from the litter layer on the gruond centimeter
Bcrown crown span of the surveyed brush crown span was measured by two dimensions of the crown with the length and width then aversage them meter
Bweight weight of the brush the whole brush was cutt down and weight freshly in the field after cutting. Then sent to lab for drying with an oven to weight the oven dry kilogram
Byear Burn year year ffom 200 to 2005
Bmonth burn moth using digital number
Bplace fire ignition place the place use national forest compartement number then suing gis to identify the coordinator
burnArea burned area the burned area using ha ad the unit hectare
